original: Häger, Åke Simon, regementsläkare, prakt, läkare, Borås, f. 5/7/97 i Mårdaklev, Älvsb. 1., av folkskoll. Johan H. o. Mina Gustavson. G. 28 m. Lena Karlson. Barn: Barbro f. 30, Ba-rit 39. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 16, med. kand. i Sthlm 22, med. lic. i Lund 27. Tf. und:läk. v. Solbackens san., Borås las. o. Are fjällkuranst. kort. tider 27 o. 28, und :läk. v. Svenishögems sian. 29-31, tf. und :läk. v. Uddevalla las. o. v. Ludvika lias. 31, bitr. läk. v. Gbgs epidisjukh. 32, tf. andre und:-läk. v. Hälsingb. las. med. avd. 32-33, andre und :läk. v. Västerås las. med. avd. 33-34, förste undiläk. 34-36, tf. läk. v. Rävlanda san. sed. 38, prakt, läk. i Borås sed. 36. Tjg. s. mil:läk. på skilda håll tills, nio mån. 26-29, bat:läk. v. Fik 33-36, v. Älvsb. reg. 36, regiläk. där sed. 43. Delt. i tävhtrup-pen i gymn. i Antw^erpen 20. RVO, RPinlLOlkl.
translated: Häger, Åke Simon, regimental doctor, practicing physician, Borås, born on July 5th, 1897 in Mårdaklev, Älvsborgs län, son of primary school teacher Johan H. and Mina Gustavson. Married in 1928 to Lena Karlson and has two children: Barbro born in 1930 and Barit born in 1939. He graduated from high school in Gothenburg in 1916, received his Bachelor of Medicine in Stockholm in 1922, and his medical license in Lund in 1927. He served as a substitute army doctor at Solbackens sanatorium and Are fjällkuranst. briefly in 1927 and 1928, substitute army doctor at Svenishöga sanatorium from 1929 until 1931, substitute army doctor at Uddevalla lasarett and Ludvika hospital in 1931, assistant doctor at Göteborgs epidemisjukhus in 1932, deputy substitute army doctor at Hälsingborgs lasarett medical department in 1932-1933, second substitute army doctor at Västerås lasarett medical department in 1933-1934, first substitute army doctor in 1934-1936, and then substitute army doctor at Rävlanda sanatorium since 1938. He has been a practicing physician in Borås since 1936. He served for a total of nine months as a military doctor in various locations from 1926 until 1929, battalion doctor at Fik from 1933 until 1936, and then at Älvsborg regiment in 1936 before becoming the regimental doctor there since 1943. He participated in the gymnastics competition team in Antwerp in 1920 and was awarded the Order of Vasa and the Royal Order of Litteris et Artibus.

awards.name: Royal Order of Litteris et Artibus
